content: As PM will also be supported with Recent topics in Zulip 6.0, what folks think of renaming "Recent topics" to something like "Recent conversations" or "Recent messages" to be more specific with functionality? Should this include the refactoring of recent_topic in code?

Hm, maybe! It would take some work to make the transition (including updating documentation and landing pages), and we would want to think about how to introduce it to users to avoid confusion. But I generally like the term "conversation" as being user-focused (not technical or product-focused), and we are using it for the "Go to conversation" button tooltip (#design > narrow to topic/pms when composing ).

Yeah, I think we've standardized on "conversation" as a generic term for, well, a single conversation thread. (Mainly appears in the Help Center, in addition to those few places it's present in the app).

So yeah, I think we should be planning to rename it to "Recent conversations", probably as an immediate follow-up to merging private messages. (I don't want to tangle an already complex PR with a name change).
